quote_last: . I must tell you how much I love you at ten minutes past eight on a Sunday evening, January 27th 1918.
title: Letter to John Middleton Murry
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote_last:
Even on a regular night, The Truth was intolerable. The floor was coated in sawdust, music that could only be described as cock-metal blasted on the sound system, Christmas lights flashed out of sync at a headache-inducing pace, and the walls were covered with faux-homey wooden signs that said shit like:
YOU ARE NEVER
2 OLD
2 DRINK
2 MANY
6 PACKS
title: Kitchens of the Great Midwest
author: J. Ryan Stradal

quote_last: on 1 April Y.D.A.U., the medical attache is still watching the unlabelled entertainment cartridge.
title: Infinite Jest
author: David Foster Wallace
